dialogues.text: It’s too fast, he won’t make it! »..and the other reporters, yelling almost in unison...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Slow down! SLOW DOWN! Everyone is yelling it, sure Big Red can’t keep it up. ON THE TRACK, Secretariat and Sham fight to get their noses front, a duel in which both would rather die than lose. ALL GOES TO SILENCE... And from the POV OF THE HOMESTRETCH, we watch the final t WAITING FOR THE HORSES TO APPFAR. The horse that comes around that turn in the lead is the horse likely to win.. We wait...we wait...We WAIT... As we wait we flash to Penny, watching breathlessly... an the crowd around her, movements slowed so much that time seems frozen, all hanging in agony to see which horse wil break and which prevail... PENNY WATCHES, suspended in heartbreaking wonder... Then SECRETARIAT--majestic, rippling, fluid, both beautif and ferocious--appears around the turn and flies onto the backstretch, Turcotte on his saddle, steady as a rock. And they are all alone. They pound onto the homestretch, hooves flashing, dirt flying; and the other horses are so behind they haven’t yet appeared. Joy, and the amazement of knowing they are witnessing something never seen before and never to be seen again, r in Penny, and then in the spectators, ALONG WITH THE SOUN

dialogues.speaker: CHIC ANDERSON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Secretariat so far in front the other horses don’t-- six lengths, Seven... Page 110 of 113  110.

dialogues.speaker: MISS HAM AND SET
dialogues.text: Come on, Red! Go! Go! All the blocd has drained from Pancho Martin’s face. SECRETARIAT crushes ahead, farther and faster than anyone could have imagined.

dialogues.speaker: CHIC ANDERSON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fourteen lengths! Sixteen! Mile and a quarter, one fifty nine flat!

dialogues.speaker: BEYER
dialogues.text: ...Faster than his Derby record! On the track it is nothing short of stunning, a portrait wonder... And Penny has taken on a look of reverence. The spectators scream from the rail as Secretariat rolls the final stretch. And Hollis, Jack, Phipps, and especial Penny’s children are all going crazy beside her.

dialogues.speaker: CHIC ANDERSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Secretariat is now alone! He is moving like a tremendous machine! He is majestic as he runs, not another horse in sight. Th fans’ eyes track him, awestruck at what they’re watching. Penny and the group cheer as he rumbles ahead, while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: CHIC ANDERSON, (V.O0.)
dialogues.text: The lead is now 24 lengths! 26 lengths! And as the noise rises even more, and the lead grows... TURCOTTE...hearing only one horse, his own...breaks his o personal rule...and he looks BACK... ---and sees nothing. No horses. No competition. The only hoof prints in the perfectly-grcoomed soil are those that put there by Red. Ronnie turns his head back, and... ...the sound and speed hits in a flurry as he drives Red the final stretch. The crescendo of the crowd culminates. Page 111 of 113  111. --.as Secretariat, without a hint of fading, flows across finish line. Setting off a celebration in all corners of Belmont Park. The moment is all-consuming. Penny lifts her eyes, just for a moment, toward heaven, w she hopes her father is watching. Miss Ham sees, and her eyes well up. Penny hugs her family. The rest of the group embraces the person next to them. Heads shake. Stunned looks; even amo Ogden Phipps and the jubilant syndicate members. Turcotte eases Secretariat up...

dialogues.speaker: BELMONT P-A ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Unofficial time...two minutes, 24 seconds! Winning margin, 31 lengths! IN THE PRESS BOX: Beyer and Nack are in shock. They look the winning time, in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: BEYER
dialogues.text: Greatest ever?

dialogues.speaker: NACK
dialogues.text: That record will never be broken. IN THE STANDS: Penny finally glances toward Pancho, who g an appreciative look, and tips his hat. She looks down to the track again... --.as Turcotte approaches the crowd, doffing his cap and accepting the roar of appreciation. He looks up... ..-and his eyes meet Penny’s. He nods. She claps her hand and blows a kiss his way. EXT. BELMONT PARK —- WINNER’S CIRCLE - A FEW MINUTES LATE And the entire group is in the winner’s circle, as Eddie Hollis guide Secretariat into position for the photograph Hollis moves over and hands the lead to Penny. They share smile. Ronnie walks toward Lucien, and just before they shake ha Turcotte motions to his silks...white as new snow. Pincay heading back to the paddock with his exhausted and defeat Sham, salutes Turcotte. Page 112 of 113  112. Penny looks toward Jack, who claps his hands. Genuinely happy for her. Her children glow, the girls wiping away tears of joy. Belmont officials place a BLANKET OF WHITE CARNATIONS ove Secretariat's neck; sweat-covered, but still magnificent. The countless photographs begin. And we move in from angl profile on the joyous group, moving closer... »..till the spotlight falls on just the two of them: Penn Chenery Tweedy and Secretariat. Secretariat lifts his hea and Penny lifts hers... In Victory. We FREEZE FRAME, and FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: THE END
dialogues.text: Page 113 of 113
